STUDENT STAFF:
SUPERVISION:
KBPS is staffed by Benson students who are
majoring in radio, and students who are in¬
terested in radio station operation. Many
Benson students earn a first class radio
operator's license entitling them to work
in commercial radio stations.
Student operators are assisted by the station
manager, producer-assistant, chief engineer,
and transmitter operator.
LEARNING EXPERIENCES: Students who work on the KBPS staff develop
skills through:
(1) announcing ( 7)
(2) newscashing (8)
(3) directing broadcasts, (9)
producing programs (10)
(Ip) writing program formats (11)
and spot announcements (12)
(5) creating sound effects
(6) operating the station’s
control boards, and turntables
setting-up microphones
s p ort s c a s ting
operating remote broadcasts
doing disc and tape recording
learning transmitter operation
installing and repairing radio
equipment
PROGRAM SCHEDULE: Programs are planned:
1. to supplement learning experiences in
the classroom through in-school listening
on all grade levels and in all subject
areas. (Many adults also listen.)
2. to give both elementary and high school
students the opportunity to participate
in and produce original radio broadcasts
3. to furnish out-of-school listening programs
to all students
Ip. to fill the needs of the community
(a) by presenting programs originated by
community groups
(b) by presenting programs specifically
planned for mature, adult listening
in the areas of music, science, art,
drama, great literature, forum and
round table discussions, and broad¬
casts which originate in other col¬
leges and universities and in cult¬
ural centers throughout the nation.
KBPS is a member of the National Association of Educational Broadcaster.
